fake_data.helpTip: If ‘true’, fake EEG data will be used instead of real EEG data. Useful for testing by software development team.

acq_device.helpTip: Specifies the method used to connect to the data acquisition device (LSL or DSI). Default: LSL

acq_host.helpTip: Specifies the host for a TCP connection (Acquisition Device Connection Method must be set to ‘DSI’). Default: 127.0.0.1

acq_port.helpTip: Specifies the port for a TCP connection (Acquisition Device Connection Method must be set to ‘DSI’). Default: 9000

eeg_buffer_len.helpTip: Specifies the number of seconds of data to add to the end of the EEG file. Default: 2

trigger_type.helpTip: Specifies whether to use a picture or auditory stimulus to calibrate trigger latency. Default: image

static_trigger_offset.helpTip: Specifies the static trigger offset (in seconds) used to align triggers properly with EEG data from LSL. The system includes built-in offset correction, but there is still a hardware-limited offset between EEG and trigger timing values for which the system does not account. The default value of 0.1 has been verified for OHSU hardware. The correct value may be different for other computers, and must be determined on a case-by-case basis. Default: .1

k_folds.helpTip: Specifies the number of folds used for cross-validation when calculating AUC. Default: 10

trial_length.helpTip: Specifies the length (in seconds) of the EEG data collection window after each stimulus presentation. Default: 0.5

offline_analysis_tone.helpTip: Specifies the path to an audio file to be played as an alert tone when offline analysis is complete. Default: bcipy/static/sounds/beep.wav

filter_high.helpTip: Specifies the frequency bound (in Hz) of the low-pass filter (high cutoff). Default: 45

filter_low.helpTip: Specifies the frequency bound (in Hz) of the high-pass filter (low cutoff). Default: 2

filter_order.helpTip: Specifies the slope of the low-pass and high-pass filters. Default: 2

notch_filter_frequency.helpTip: Specifies the frequency (in Hz) of the notch filter used to remove electrical artifact from the surrounding environment. Default: 60

down_sampling_rate.helpTip: Specifies the decimation factor (integer only) for downsampling of EEG data. Default: 2

artifact_rejection.helpTip: If ‘true’, the system will detect and reject sequences containing unwanted artifacts (e.g. blinks). This is not implemented in the current version of the system.

high_voltage_threshold.helpTip: If ‘true’, an upper voltage threshold will be set for artifact rejection. Detection of values above the specified threshold will trigger rejection of a sequence. This is not implemented in the current version of the system.

high_voltage_value.helpTip: Specifies the high voltage threshold (in microvolts) for artifact rejection (High Voltage Threshold must be set to ‘true’). Default: 75E+6. This is not implemented in the current version of the system.

low_voltage_threshold.helpTip: If ‘true’, a lower voltage threshold will be set for artifact rejection. Detection of values below the specified threshold will trigger rejection of a sequence. This is not implemented in the current version of the system.

low_voltage_value.helpTip: Specifies the low voltage threshold (in microvolts) for artifact rejection (Low Voltage Threshold must be set to ‘true’). Default: -75E-6 This is not implemented in the current version of the system.

buffer_name.helpTip: Specifies the filename for EEG buffer database storage. Default: raw_data.db

raw_data_name.helpTip: Specifies the filename for EEG data storage in a CSV. Default: raw_data.csv

experiment_data_name.helpTip: Specifies the filename for field data collected for your experiment

trigger_file_name.helpTip: Specifies the filename for an output file with trigger timing information. Default: triggers.txt

session_file_name.helpTip: Specifies the filename for session data from a typing task or other non-calibration task. Default: session.json

log_name.helpTip: Specifies the name of the main log file for each BciPy session. Default: bcipy_system_log.txt

trial_complete_message.helpTip: Message that displays at the end of trial

parameter_location.helpTip: Specifies the file containing the current system parameters. Default: bcipy/parameters/parameters.json

data_save_loc.helpTip: Specifies the location in which to save data files after each recording. This must be a directory ending with /. Default: data/

full_screen.helpTip: If ‘true’, the task will be displayed in full screen mode. If ‘false’, the task will be displayed in a window.

window_height.helpTip: Specifies the height (in pixels) of the task window when not in full screen mode (Full Screen Mode On/Off must be set to ‘false’). Default: 500

window_width.helpTip: Specifies the width (in pixels) of the task window when not in full screen mode (Full Screen Mode On/Off must be set to ‘false’). Default: 500

acq_show_viewer.helpTip: If ‘true’, the EEG signal viewer will be displayed.

stim_screen.helpTip: Specifies which monitor to use for task display when two monitors are in use. If ‘0’, the task will be displayed on the primary monitor (with the EEG signal viewer on the second monitor, if EEG Viewer On/Off is set to ‘true’). If ‘1’, the opposite monitor assignment will be used.

task_buffer_len.helpTip: Specifies the delay time (in seconds) between the final stimulus in one sequence and the beginning (target stimulus or fixation cross) of the next sequence in an RSVP task. Default: 0.75

is_txt_stim.helpTip: If ‘true’, text stimuli will be used. If ‘false’, image stimuli will be loaded from the folder specified in Image Stimulus Folder.

path_to_presentation_images.helpTip: Specifies the location of image files to be used as stimuli (Text Stimuli On/Off must be set to ‘false’). This must be a directory ending with /.

stim_space_char.helpTip: Specifies the text or Unicode character which represents a space during text-stimuli tasks. Default: –

stim_length.helpTip: Specifies the number of stimuli to present in each sequence. Default: 10

time_flash.helpTip: Specifies the duration of time (in seconds) that each stimulus is displayed in the RSVP stream.

stim_pos_x.helpTip: Specifies the center point of the stimulus position along the X axis. Possible values range from -1 to 1, with 0 representing the center. Default: 0

stim_pos_y.helpTip: Specifies the center point of the stimulus position along the Y axis. Possible values range from -1 to 1, with 0 representing the center. Default: 0

stim_font.helpTip: Specifies the font used for text stimuli. Default: Arial

stim_height.helpTip: Specifies the height (in ???) of text stimuli. Possible values range from X to X. Default: 0.6

stim_color.helpTip: Specifies the color of text stimuli within the RSVP stream. Default: white

target_color.helpTip: Specifies the color of target characters during calibration. Default: white

fixation_color.helpTip: Specifies the color of the fixation cross that appears before each sequence. Default: red

alert_sounds_path.helpTip: Specifies the location of audio files to be presented with visual stimuli during the Alert Tone Calibration Task. This must be a directory ending with /. Default: bcipy/static/sounds/rsvp_sounds/

alert_sound_delay.helpTip: Delay (in seconds) between playing an alert tone and presenting the target during the Alert Tone Calibration Task. Default: 0.4

background_color.helpTip: Specifies the color of the task background. Default: black

session_complete_message.helpTip: Specifies the message displayed at the end of an RSVP session.

session_complete_message_color.helpTip: Specifies the text color for the message displayed at the end of an RSVP session. Default: white

task_font.helpTip: Specifies the font used for task-specific text, e.g. #/100 in calibration and target phrase in copy/spelling. Default: Arial

task_height.helpTip: Specifies the height (in ???) of task-specific text, e.g. #/100 in calibration and target phrase in copy/spelling. Possible values range from X to X. Default: 0.1

task_color.helpTip: Specifies the color of task-specific text, e.g. #/100 in calibration and target phrase in copy/spelling. Default: white

wait_screen_message.value: Press Space to start or Esc to exit
wait_screen_message.helpTip: Specifies the message displayed before starting a session and during pauses. Default: Press Space to start or Esc to exit

wait_screen_message_color.helpTip: Specifies the text color of the message displayed before starting a session and during pauses. Default: white

stim_number.helpTip: Specifies the number of sequences to present in a calibration session. Default: 100

enable_breaks.helpTip: If ‘true’, automatic breaks will be added to the calibration session. If ‘false’, automatic breaks will not occur, but the session can still be paused by pressing Space.

break_len.helpTip: Specifies the length (in seconds) of automatic calibration breaks (Automatic Calibration Breaks On/Off must be set to ‘true’).

trials_before_break.helpTip: Specifies the number of sequences between automatic calibration breaks (Automatic Calibration Breaks On/Off must be set to ‘true’).

break_message.helpTip: Specifies the message displayed during automatic calibration breaks (Automatic Calibration Breaks On/Off must be set to ‘true’).

min_seq_len.helpTip: The minimum number of sequences to present in spelling tasks

max_seq_len.helpTip: Specifies the maximum number of sequences to present in copy/spelling tasks. The task will end if this number is reached.

max_seq_per_trial.helpTip: Maximum number of sequences to present for a single trial before making a decision

max_minutes.helpTip: Specifies the time limit (in minutes) for copy/spelling tasks. The task will end if this time limit is reached.

decision_threshold.helpTip: Specifies the decision threshold for stimulus selection in copy/spelling class. If the posterior probability (combining EEG and language model evidence) for a stimulus reaches this threshold, it will be selected. Possible value range: 0.0-1.0. Default: 0.8

min_seq_per_series.helpTip: Specifies the minimum number of sequences to present before making a decision in copy/spelling tasks. Default: 1

max_seq_per_series.helpTip: Specifies the maximum number of sequences to present before making a decision in copy/spelling tasks.

backspace_always_shown.helpTip: If ‘true’, the backspace character will be included in every sequence in text-stimuli copy/spelling tasks. If ‘false’, the backspace character will be treated the same as other characters, appearing in sequences only when warranted by EEG/language model evidence.

task_text.helpTip: Specifies the target phrase displayed at the top of the screen during text-stimuli copy/spelling tasks.

spelled_letters_count.helpTip: Specifies the number of letters in the target phrase that are already typed when the task begins, e.g. if the target phrase is “THE_DOG”, setting this parameter to ‘4’ would display “THE_” as the typed string, and the user would begin typing with D. If ‘0’, the typed string will be blank.

word_matching_text_size.helpTip: Specifies the height (in ???) of words used as stimuli in the word-icon matching task. Possible values range from X to X. Default: 0.2

lang_model_enabled.helpTip: If ‘true’, the language model will be enabled, and language model evidence will be incorporated into calculation of posterior probabilities. If ‘false’, posterior probabilities will be calculated based on EEG evidence only.

lang_model_type.helpTip: Specifies which language model to use (PRELM or OCLM). OCLM does not work in the current version of the system. Default: PRELM

lm_backspace_prob.helpTip: Specifies the initial probability assigned to the backspace character in the language model. Possible value range: 0.0-1.0. Default: 0.05

path_to_fst.helpTip: Specifies the FST file for the language model corpus. Default: language_model/fst/brown_closure.n5.kn.fst

lang_model_server_host.helpTip: Specifies the host for language model server integration. Default: 127.0.0.1

lang_model_server_port.helpTip: Specifies the port for language model server integration. Default: 5000

show_feedback.helpTip: If ‘true’, feedback will be displayed in the feedback calibration task.

feedback_buffer_time.helpTip: Specifies the length of time (in seconds) between the end of a sequence and the onset of feedback display in the feedback calibration task. Default: 1

feedback_flash_time.helpTip: Specifies the length of time (in seconds) feedback will be displayed after each sequence in the feedback calibration task. Default: 2

feedback_pos_x.helpTip: Specifies the position of the left edge of the feedback display on the screen. Possible values range from -1 to 1, with 0 representing the center. Default: -0.72

feedback_pos_y.helpTip: Specifies the position of the upper edge of the feedback display on the screen. Possible values range from -1 to 1, with 0 representing the center. Default: 0

feedback_stim_height.helpTip: Specifies the height of the feedback boxes (in ???). Default: 0.35

feedback_stim_width.helpTip: Specifies the width of the feedback boxes (in ???). Default: 0.35

feedback_line_width.helpTip: Specifies the stroke width of the feedback box outline. Default: 1

feedback_line_color.helpTip: Specifies the color of the feedback box outline. Default: white

feedback_padding.helpTip: Specifies the distance (in ???) between feedback boxes. Default: 0.37

feedback_target_line_width.helpTip: Specifies the stroke width of the target feedback box outline. Default: 100

psd_method.helpTip: Specifies the method used to approximate power spectral density bands (Welch or MultiTaper). Default: Welch

feedback_band_lower_limit.helpTip: Specifies the lower bound (in Hz) for the target power spectral density band used for generating feedback. Default: 8

feedback_band_upper_limit.helpTip: Specifies the upper bound (in Hz) for the target power spectral density band used for generating feedback. Default: 10

feedback_level_descending.helpTip: Controls the directionality of the feedback band cutoffs specified above. If ‘true’, descending feedback level will be used, such that the system will assume that higher PSD values correspond with better feedback. If ‘false’, the system will assume that lower PSD values correspond with better feedback. Default: false

feedback_level_2_threshold.helpTip: Specifies the threshold (as a relative PSD value) between feedback level 1 (very bad/red) and level 2 (bad/orange). Default: 0.3780

feedback_level_3_threshold.helpTip: Specifies the threshold (as a relative PSD value) between feedback level 2 (bad/orange) and level 3 (medium/yellow). Default: 0.3147

feedback_level_4_threshold.helpTip: Specifies the threshold (as a relative PSD value) between feedback level 3 (medium/yellow) and level 4 (good/light green). Default: 0.2693

feedback_level_5_threshold.helpTip: Specifies the threshold (as a relative PSD value) between feedback level 4 (good/light green) and level 5 (very good/green). Default: 0.2052
